title.rendered: Idumota Market, Location, Market Days, Parks and Shipments, Hotels

content.rendered:
Idumota Market is a famous market in Lagos that is known for its significant sales of videos and many musical albums. The market is known as one of the oldest markets in Lagos. The Idumota city was previously the location of an armed forces remembrance cenotaph called Soja Idumota, built as a monument to Nigerian soldiers who served with the West African Frontier Force. The Idumota market needs to be created to serve as a sales hub for the people living in the area.

Some statue features describe the age of the market, including the Eyo masquerade and a clocktower.

Location

The Idumota market is near Bankole Street, Lagos Island,  Lagos, Nigeria. The market is less than a kilometer drive if you are familiar with the UBA office. Ring Road, Adeniji Adele Road, Custom Rd, Broad Street, UBA Head office, First Bank Park, Tafawa Balewa Square, and lots more surround Idumota market.

Market Days

This market operates on a weekday basis, including weekends. On other days, the market becomes more populated when product importation is due.

Products to Look for in Idumota Market

Although Idumota Market is known for its high value of videos and other musical albums, it also distributes first-class products, including electronics, jewelry, clothes, computers and computer accessories, homes and furniture, and lots more.

Parks and Shipments

Available parks near Idumota market are First Bank Park, UBA Park, CBN Park, and other mini-parks that aid in the shipment of goods to nearby transport agencies. Alternatively, one can engage other freight routes available by trucks, trains, ships, and transport agencies to ship goods to the desired location.

Hotels Near Idumota

There are many hotels surrounding the Idumota market, Lagos. These are;

  • The Beni Hotels
  • XGarden Hotel and Suites
  • Cariton Hotel Apapa
  • Radisson Blu Anchorage Hotels
  • Eko Hotels and Suites
  • De Rigg Place, Victoria Island
